translated: One copy of the text for bowing and repentance
All respectfully bow to the eternally abiding Three Jewels. This is the assembly of the ten directions.
The fragrant food of the adornment of wisdom. May this cloud of incense and flowers transform and fill the worlds of the ten directions.
Making offerings to all Buddhas, transformed bodies, and Bodhisattvas, and countless Shravakas. The cloud of incense and flowers is received.
With the light of the platform of light, in the boundless world, the boundless and immeasurable one becomes a Buddha.
Making offerings and respectfully bowing to all, recite the Mahaprajnaparamita.
The Tathagata's wondrous form body is unequaled and incomparable in the world, inconceivable.
Therefore, now respectfully bow to the Tathagata's form.
The inexhaustible wisdom is also like this.
All dharmas are eternally abiding. At that time, return to respectfully bow to the eternally abiding Three Jewels. Praising the Buddha's merits.
The Buddha has thirty-two marks and eighty minor marks.
Called the three realms, liberating sentient beings, accomplishing the Buddha's path.
Namo to the Tathagata Sumeru Lamp Light in the East, and all Buddhas in the ten directions.
Namo to the Tathagata Vipashyin, the Seven Buddhas of the Past, and all Buddhas.
Namo to the Tathagata Universal Light, the Fifty-three Buddhas, and all Buddhas.
Namo to the Tathagata Good Virtue in the East, the Immeasurable Buddhas in the Ten Directions, and all Buddhas.
Namo to the Tathagata Kanthaka, the Thousand Buddhas of the Worthy Kalpa, and all Buddhas.
Namo to the Tathagata Shakyamuni, the Thirty-five Buddhas, and all Buddhas.
Namo to the Tathagata Akshobhya in the East, the Fifteen Thousand Buddhas, and all Buddhas.
Namo to the Tathagata Guardian Assembly, the Twenty-five Buddhas, and all Buddhas.
Namo to the Buddha of Pure Light of Dharma, the Lotus Flower that Opens the Directions.

Therefore, one should sincerely repent the six sense faculties with diligence.
Repenting and taking refuge in the Three Jewels with utmost sincerity, making vows, wishing that we may hear and understand liberation in every life, in every world, of all Buddhas.
The great vows are equal, delivering sentient beings.
Ultimately accomplishing the unsurpassed Way.
Making vows and taking refuge in the Three Jewels with utmost sincerity.
Reciting verses and making vows, wishing to use this merit to benefit all.
May we and all sentient beings together accomplish the Way of the Buddha.
Announcing to the assembly, listening to the impermanence verse of dusk - the sun sets in the west.
Afflictions have subtle dust.
Old age, sickness, and death arrive.
Looking at each other, not staying.
Moment by moment, urging the years to end.
Like a fish in shallow water.
Encouraging the assembly practicing the Way.
Diligent study, reaching fearlessness.
Announcing to the assembly, listening to the impermanence verse of the first night - afflictions have no bottom, the ocean of birth and death has no end.
The boat of crossing suffering has not yet arrived.
How can one enjoy sleeping?
One should be awakened from sleep.
Do not let sleep cover the mind.
Be diligent and energetic, and the path to enlightenment will naturally arise.ğŸ”½Respectfully pay homage to Vairocana Buddha
Respectfully pay homage to Vairocana Buddha

Respectfully pay homage to Buddha Attaining Freedom from Sorrow in the SoutheastğŸ”½Respectfully pay homage to Buddha Sandalwood in the South
Respectfully pay homage to Buddha Jewel Victory in the Southwest
Respectfully pay homage to Buddha Immeasurable Light in the WestğŸ”½Respectfully pay homage to Buddha Flower Attainment in the Northwest
Respectfully pay homage to Buddha Sign Attainment in the North
Respectfully pay homage to Buddha Three Excellent Practices in the Northeast
Respectfully pay homage to Buddha Vast Assembly Attainment in the Upper Direction
Respectfully pay homage to Buddha Attaining Light in the Lower Direction
Respectfully pay homage to the future Maitreya Buddha who will appear in the world. Respectfully pay homage to all Buddhas of the past, present, and future in the ten directions and three times
Respectfully pay homage to the immeasurable jeweled stupas in the form of Å›arÄ«ra
Respectfully pay homage to the profound Dharma treasury of the twelve divisions of the scriptures
I respectfully bow to the assembly of great bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas
I respectfully bow to the Å›rÄvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and all the sages and saints, all respectfully, to the eight classes of spiritual beings, and to the kings of the good spiritual gods

I respectfully bow to the eternally abiding Three Jewels, who are the leaders of the path for all teachers of the past and presentğŸ”½I respectfully bow to the eternally abiding Three Jewels, whose imperial rule and sage transformation are endless
I respectfully bow to the eternally abiding Three Jewels, whose blessings extend to the myriad branches for princes and kings
I respectfully bow to the eternally abiding Three Jewels, for the teachers, parents, and good spiritual friends
I respectfully bow to the eternally abiding Three Jewels, for the donors of the ten directions, whose six perfections are complete
I respectfully bow to the eternally abiding Three Jewels, for the suffering sentient beings, who wish to be free from suffering
I respectfully bow to the eternally abiding Three Jewels, for the officials of the literary path, whose emoluments and positions are constant
I respectfully bow to the eternally abiding Three Jewels, for the peace and security of the country, where the Dharma wheel always turns
I respectfully bow to the eternally abiding Three Jewels, for the sentient beings of the Dharma realm
Repenting by Bowing to the Buddha Repenting with utmost sincerity, the Buddhas of the immeasurable ten directions know all without exception.
I now confess all of them, turning away from the three evil paths.
The three sets of three make nine kinds.
They arise from the three afflictions.
If there are offenses in this body or in past lives, I repent of them all.
If I should receive karmic retribution in the three evil paths, I wish to receive it in this body.
May I never enter the evil paths.

Having received the repentance, I take refuge and pay homage to the Three Treasures. With utmost sincerity, I exhort and request the TathÄgatas of the ten directions who have attained enlightenment in the present to
I request them to turn the wheel of the Dharma and bring peace and joy to all beings.
If all the Buddhas of the ten directions wish to relinquish their lives,
I now bow my head and life to exhort and request them to remain for a long time.
Having exhorted and requested, I take refuge and pay homage to the Three Treasures. With utmost sincerity, I rejoice in all the blessings of generosity,
Upholding precepts, cultivating meditation and wisdom,
Arising from body, speech, and mind.
Now, all those who study the Three Vehicles,
Those who are fully endowed with the One Vehicle,
And the immeasurable blessings of humans and devas,
I rejoice in them all. I take refuge and pay homage to the Three Treasures. With utmost sincerity, I dedicate the merit.
All the meritorious deeds I have done, I gather them all together for the sake of liberating sentient beings.
I sincerely dedicate them to the path of Buddhahood.
I confess my offenses in this way, rejoice in the merits of others, and dedicate them towards enlightenment.
I take refuge and pay homage to the Three Jewels with utmost sincerity and make this vow:
May all sentient beings equally give rise to the bodhi mind.
May their minds always contemplate the Buddhas of the ten directions.
I vow that all sentient beings will forever eradicate afflictions,
And clearly see the Buddha-nature like the Wonderful Virtue Buddha.
Having made this vow, I take refuge and pay homage to the Three Jewels. I declare to the assembly this morning's pure verse:
If one wishes to attain the bliss of quiescence,
One should study the Dharma of Åšramaá¹‡as.
Clothing and food sustain the body and life.ğŸ”½All the assembly, whether refined or coarse,
Are pure this morning.
Each should keep the six recollections in mind.
All should be respectful.
I take refuge in the Buddha.
May all sentient beings embody the great way and give rise to the thought of impermanence.
I take refuge in the Dharma.
May all sentient beings deeply enter the treasury of scriptures and have wisdom like the ocean.
I take refuge in the Sangha.
May all sentient beings govern the great assembly without any obstruction.
May all sentient beings with pure three karmas uphold the Buddha's teachings.
I pay homage to all sages and virtuous ones.
On the 22nd day of the 4th month in the 2nd year of Xiande (ä¹™å¯), monk Xin Yuan of Da Xuan Temple presented the record.
